description: 3 up, 3 down, 3 up, ... permutations of length 3n+1.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(u+o=0, 1, add(`if`(t=3,       b(o-j, u+j-1, 1), b(u+j-1, o-j, t+1)), j=1..o))    end:a:= n-> b(0, 3*n+1, 0):seq(a(n), n=1..20);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 06 2013
mathematica: b[u_, o_, t_] := b[u, o, t] = If[u+o == 0, 1, Sum[If[t == 3, b[o-j, u+j-1, 1], b[u+j-1, o-j, t+1]], {j, 1, o}]] ; a[n_] := b[0, 3*n+1, 0]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 20}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 25 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Typo in name fixed by _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 06 2013
